intro: Dendropanax oblongus, commonly known as the broad-leaf arrowhead, is a flowering plant native to eastern Australia. It is a member of the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive arrowhead-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with compound leaves that are alternate and often have a waxy texture. It produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, followed by dark blue berries that are edible for some wildlife. Dendropanax oblongus is often found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and coastal areas.
